explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses the use of machine learning techniques, specifically Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL), for financial portfolio management.
explanations.reinforcement learning: The paper focuses on Deep Reinforcement Learning (DRL) approaches for portfolio management, specifically using the Proximal Policy Optimization (PPO) algorithm.
explanations.deep learning: The paper mentions the use of Deep Neural Networks (DNNs) as part of the DRL approach for portfolio management.
explanations.neural network: The paper refers to Deep Neural Networks (DNNs) as the models used to represent the distribution of expected rewards in the DRL approach.
explanations.representation learning: The paper involves learning representations of financial states and actions in the DRL framework.
explanations.hidden layer: Deep Neural Networks (DNNs) typically include hidden layers, which are implied in the discussion of DNNs used in the DRL approach.
explanations.Proximal Policy Optimization: The paper specifically mentions the use of the Proximal Policy Optimization (PPO) algorithm, a reinforcement learning technique.
explanations.PPO: Abbreviation for Proximal Policy Optimization, which is a key algorithm used in the paper.
explanations.SHAP: The paper integrates SHAP (SHapley Additive exPlanations) as one of the explainable machine learning techniques to enhance transparency.
explanations.LIME: The paper integrates LIME (Local Interpretable Model-agnostic Explanations) as one of the explainable machine learning techniques to enhance transparency.
